channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14505] Reenable tests disabled by HBASE-14430 in TestHttpServerLifecycle
item.description:
Probably needs newer version of jetty or some cryptic JVM version.

See HBASE-14430 for litany on how hard this is to reproduce, not only in hbase, but back up in the Jetty where the issue was also reported.
item.summary: Reenable tests disabled by HBASE-14430 in TestHttpServerLifecycle

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: Validate Jetty 7 for tests

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12766218/HBASE-14505.1.patch
against master branch at commit ac82a863201e7c846ce3136f37727646e0ea0172.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation, build,
or dev-support patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.6.1 2.7.0 2.7.1)

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.namespace.TestNamespaceAuditor.testRegionOperations(TestNamespaceAuditor.java:469)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15994//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15994//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15994//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15994//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15994//console

This message is automatically generated.

Should we go to jetty 9 Gabor Liptak ? IIRC, the package names are all different from our current jetty ... so should be no possibility of our clashing with hadoop? I came across this blog a while ago and it seemed to be good on how to do upgrade: http://blog.softwaredemo.com/2014/02/06/embedded-jetty-how-to-upgrade-from-version-6-to-9/ Might be too much work and the move to jetty7 might be enough.

stack Thank you for the pointer on the Jetty 9 upgrade. In this ticket, I was targeting to bring back these tests with minimal required change. I'm open to work a wider upgrade of Jetty version (maybe on a followup ticket?). As for validation, what would be the best way to validate here (force rerun multiple times maybe?)?

Gabor Liptak Understood. Follow-up would be fine (there may be a ticket already). Jetty7 has same package and artifactid as jetty6? Having jetty6 and jetty7 on the classpath could make for headaches if this is so: i.e. when hadoop is on the classpath. On validation, thats the tough one. These tests all passed for me fine locally only failing up on apache jenkins (the joy of a dodgy CI) Thanks.
stack Jetty 7 (latest) had same packages, but a different artifact id (under eclipse.org). Yes, hadoop-common does bring in Jetty 6. The test run was successful ...

If same package, then we could pick up classes from jetty7 if it is before jetty6 in the classpath? Could make for some fun, fun, fun! If you want we could try it out on master branch. Try running it here a few times to see if http issues come back?

Hmm ... My thought would be that we will get a consistent set (Jetty6 only or Jetty7 only). Would Hadoop be interested in a Jetty upgrade? When you say running here, do you mean cancelling/resubmitting the patch?

Yeah, resubmitting a few times.

On hadoop and jetty7, you'd probably get further talking jetty9 IMO – or at least, you'd get more attention? Could align nicely w/ hadoop3?
I wanted jetty9 so could more easily add web tools and libs to draw pretty diagrams... not important but nice-to-have
I cancelled and submitted the path, but there was no new build ... Do I need to uploaded a new patch file to trigger?
